game.name: 3D MineStorm (1983)
game.desc: In 3D Mine Storm, the player controls a ship through multiple mine fields destroying all mines on each field to progress to the next field. The game will start with the enemy minelayer seeding the first mine field. Mines are left in 3 different levels or planes per field. The player's ship will come into view after all the mines have been activated and the minelayer has left the field.

game.name: 3D Narrow Escape (1983)
game.desc: Enter the stellar fortress of a 23rd century warlord whose evil intent is to dominate your home star system and enslave all its inhabitants. Your mission is to navigate through the narrow and fast-moving passages of the fortress and destroy the warlord's defense forces and his powerful arsenal. Beware... the passages of the fortress will encircle you in 3-D terror while the warlord's defense systems will become increasingly more menacing. Will you succumb to the evil of the warlord or destroy him and make a Narrow Escape?!

game.name: All Good Things (1996)
game.desc:
All Good Things, was the world´s first 16K Vectrex cartridge, created by John Dondzila. Compiled together were four great games on the one cartridge.
The games are: - More Invaders - Rockaroids - Vectris - Spike´s Water Balloons
Plus there is a secret bonus game too!

game.name: AnimAction: Advanced Animation (1983) (light pen)
game.desc: ANIMACTION is the first video craft of its kind that enables you to create and animate your own art like never before! ANIMACTION's totally new concept lets you create any scene using pre-drawn figures and shapes... and then combine those with other figures, backgrounds and scenery you draw yourself!

game.name: Armor..Attack (1982)
game.desc: Maneuver your jeep through the streets and alleys of an occupied town. Hide from the enemy tanks behind buildings and launch your own surprise attack! Improve your chance of survival by playing with an alley. But beware of the deadly helicopter flying overhead . . . no place is safe from this treacherous enemy.

game.name: Art Master (1983) (light pen)
game.desc:
ART MASTER is a high performance, state-of-the-art experience that takes you into a world of art exploration you've never seen before! Finally, sketching comes of age... and your creativity comes to life. Advanced electronics technology now makes it possible for you to design, draw, and animate your own art! Draw a bird. Then watch it fly! Sketch a train. Then send it speeding down the railroad tracks! Watch a flower blow in the wind or children walk to school. What you create... you can animate.
You don't have to be a super-artist to use and enjoy Art Master. All you need is a sense of adventure, fun and a little imagination! We'll show you how to make Art Master the key that unlocks all the creativity you've always known you had!

game.name: Battle Earth Terror Hazard (2000) (PD)
game.desc: L'idea è di usare i pulsanti 1-4 per saltare da un masso (asteroide) a un altro ed evitare di colpire il campo di forza correndo sui bordi.

game.name: Bedlam (1983)
game.desc:
Your home galaxy has been invaded by alien colonists hoping to claim all inhabited worlds as their own. Unacceptable! You have been given the ultimate responsibility of protecting your galactic neighbors from the invaders. Blasting the aliens with the amazing anti-molecular cannon transports them thousands of light years away where they will cause no further bedlam. But beware, the invaders will be increasingly ruthless.
The future of the galaxy rests on your shoulders. Good luck!

game.name: Berzerk (1982)
game.desc: Maneuver your humanoid through the electrified mazes of robot filled rooms. You may kill the first group of robots but initial success does not mean survival... future groups begin firing at you! Added danger lurks when Evil Otto enters. He can jump the maze walls and squash you if you linger too long!

game.name: Birds of Prey (1999)
game.desc: Este es un clon de Phoenix, donde el jugador dispara a una variedad de pájaros. Un escudo se usa para protegerse de los ataques y también puede matar a un pájaro. El jugador aún puede disparar pero no moverse, y no puede volver a usar el escudo durante unos segundos después.

game.name: Blitz!: American Football (1982)
game.desc: Will you have a championship season or just be an also-ran? You're in control as head coach of this championship caliber squad. Run, pass, punt, kick field goals -- all the excitement of a real game. Play against the computer's tough defense or invite a visiting coach to join in a real showdown!

game.name: ZZZ(notgame):Bubble Bobble (Diamond Room) (1998) (PD)
game.desc:
Bubble Bobble ist die Geschichte zweier Menschen, Bub und Bob, die in die mysteriöse Monsterhöhle schlendern und sich auf magische Weise in Drachen verwandeln. Die einzige Möglichkeit, sich zurück zu verwandeln, besteht darin, das Ende der Höhle zu erreichen...
Bubble Bobble ist ein Plattformspiel, bei dem jedes Level ein Bildschirm ist. Alle Feinde müssen in einem Level besiegt werden, um zum nächsten zu gelangen. Mit einem Spieler, der Bub kontrolliert und dem anderen, der Bob kontrolliert, kann der Spieler springen und Gegenstände für Punkte (wie Obst) sammeln. Die wahre Kraft, die Bub und Bob haben, ist jedoch die Fähigkeit, Blasen zu blasen. Diese Blasen können als Plattformen dienen, auf die man springen kann, oder man kann Feinde in ihnen fangen. Auf Feinde, die in einer Blase gefangen sind, muss man springen, damit diese zu Früchten werden. Außerdem schweben manchmal Power-Ups in Blasen. Dazu gehören Blitze, die Feinde horizontal treffen, und Wasser, das Spieler und Feinde direkt über Plattformen nach unten spült. Wenn Sie zu lange brauchen, um ein Level zu beenden, wird Baron Von Blubba gerufen, der auf dem Bildschirm herumschwebt und versucht, den Spieler zu zerstören.

game.name: Clean Sweep (1982)
game.desc: Evil bank robbers have just blown your bank to smithereens. As bank president, you only have a vacuum available to recover the money strewn among the rubble, before the thieves destroy you! The thieves get increasingly anxious, but for added challenge, turn off the lights of the bank's corridors and gather the money through a blind maze.

game.name: Engine Analyzer (1983) (light pen)
game.desc: Engine Analyzer was a diagnostic tool released by GCE for the Vectrex in 1983.

game.name: Etch-a-sketch By Jeff Woolsey (1985) (light pen) (PD)
game.desc: Just like it sounds, this is a Vectrex version of the long-produced drawing toy. Needs the Light Pen though.

game.name: Fortress of Narzod (1982)
game.desc: A long time ago, before our history began, wizards - both good and evil - battled for supremacy of the earth. It was a time of magic and adventure when all men possessed special powers. The most evil wizard, Narzod, gained the power to enslave all mankind. You are the only remaining honorable wizard with the knowledge to harness all the forces of good to defeat Narzod and destroy his sinister fortress. But Narzod has prepared for your approach and guards his realm with deadly creatures of darkness, including the Mystic Hurler. Beware, and approach the Fortress of Narzod with great caution!

game.name: Gravitrex (2002)
game.desc: Gravitrex is a clone of Gravitar, although with many differences, such as the addition of humans dotting the planetary landscapes that have to be rescued.

game.name: Heads-Up: Action Soccer (1983)
game.desc: Take the ultimate soccer challenge... without ever leaving your seat! Play with a friend or tackle the computer itself in an action-packed soccer game that takes all the concentration, strategy and split-second reactions of the real thing! You're in control as the realistic, dimensional players get the ball down the field by passing, bouncing and kicking it back and forth to one another - just like a real soccer game! HEADS-UP! And get ready for an exciting and demanding soccer tournament... complete with the roar of the crowd!

game.name: HyperChase - Auto Race (1982)
game.desc: Watch our for the guardrail! You're behind the wheel of your formula one racer about to start the world's toughest grand prix. Try to stay alive through city streets and country roads. Start your engine - the start lights are counting down!

game.name: Melody Master: Music Composition and Entertainment (1983) (light pen)
game.desc: MELODY MASTER is a high performance learning tool that's easy, educational and most of all...fun! Join the electronic revolution and let your own musical creativity come to life! State-of-the-art technology now makes it possible for you to read music, recognize notes by ear and create anything you can hear. Try to compose a hit song! Play and old favorite! Watch your musical dreams take shape and sound!

game.name: MineStorm (1982)
game.desc: The game begins with a large enemy ship dropping mines onto the field as an ominous jingle plays, and moves from the top to the bottom of the screen, where it disappears. The player's ship starts in the middle of the field with 5 lives. Numerous mines then start popping up. The player must destroy all of the mines in order to progress to the next minefield. All of the mines can be destroyed with one shot, or hit with the player's ship, costing the player a life. There are 4 types of mines. This game came programmed onto the Vectrex.

game.name: MineStorm II (1983)
game.desc:
Mine Storm is the built-in game that came with every Vectrex unit. It was also released in a 3-D version that required the use of the Vectrex 3D Imager and Mine Storm 2 is a debugged version of Mine Storm.
One of the built-in versions of Mine Storm had a glitch that made the game crash at level 13, so GCE decided to send a copy of Mine Storm 2 to gamers that wrote to the company and complained.
This game is rare, because most of the gamers didn't know about the offer, and also because not many gamers got to level 13.

game.name: Nonagalf (Mar 10) (2003)
game.desc: A golf game or perhaps a mini-golf game for the Vectrex.

game.name: Omega Chase (2000) (PD)
game.desc: Omega Race era un juego de arcade donde los jugadores volaban alrededor de un campo de juego limitado mientras destruían objetos. A diferencia de muchos otros juegos donde las colisiones con las paredes destruirían la nave de un jugador, los jugadores podrían rebotar en las paredes en Omega Race. Omega Chase es un clon de Omega Race.

game.name: Patriots (1996)
game.desc: El juego en sí está inspirado en el arcade y el juego Atari 2600 Missile Command. El jugador controla una serie de cañones a nivel del suelo y debe usarlos para proteger seis bases que no tienen defensas. Olas de misiles descenderán en un curso para eliminar tanto los cañones como las bases del jugador.

game.path: ./Patriots III - BALListics Busters by John Dondzila (1996).zip
game.name: Patriots III: Ballistics Busters (1996)
game.desc: Patriots III Ballistics Busters es una versión completamente reescrita del juego original con tres cañones y munición ilimitada. En esta versión, los cañones del jugador requerirán tiempo para recargarse, pero nunca se quedarán sin misiles como en las versiones anteriores. Además, esta versión también tiene una opción para controlar los sitios del jugador o la retícula a través de controles analógicos, en lugar de solo con controles digitales. Estos controles se parecen más a los controles utilizados en la versión arcade que eran los de una bola de seguimiento.
game.image: ./media/screenshot/Patriots III - BALListics Busters by John Dondzila (1996).png

game.name: Patriots Remix (1999)
game.desc: Si bien la versión de Patriots de 1996 se considera la original, Patriots Remix tiene un juego idéntico pero difiere en el uso de efectos de sonido multicanal y gráficos optimizados.

game.name: Polar Rescue (1983)
game.desc: Journey to the icy waters beneath the North Pole. As commander of a powerful and highly maneuverable submarine, you must rescue the survivors of an ill-fated expedition. Seek out the survivors on your sonar screen and pilot your sub to their rescue! To complete your mission, you must avoid deadly mine fields, enemy submarines and the terror of the maelstrom! Monitor your oxygen supply carefully and hurry! Lives are at stake!

game.name: Pole Position (1982)
game.desc: The spectacular arcade game, Pole Position, takes on an exciting new look through the magic of Vectrex! Experience all the challenge of a Grand Prix racing event with non-stop action that'll leave you breathless! Do you possess the skill, dexterity and courage to pull out from the crowd for qualification in one of the exclusive starting positions... or will you end up as an also ran?

game.name: Repulse (1999)
game.desc:
Este es un clon de Eliminator, donde el jugador debe destruir una fortaleza flotante mientras evade las naves centinela. Las naves centinelas se descontrolarán cuando disparen, pero no pueden ser destruidas; el jugador solo puede dispararles y, con suerte, golpearlos contra la fortaleza, que los destruirá temporalmente (aunque reaparecerán en segundos), y también pueden dispararte de la misma manera. Si la fortaleza no se destruye después de un tiempo, su alienígena emergerá de ella y te perseguirá, pero si se dispara varias veces, volverá a aparecer dentro de la fortaleza.
Chocar con la fortaleza o ser disparado por el alienígena hará que el jugador pierda una nave; Después de que se hayan agotado todas las naves, el juego termina. Se otorga un barco adicional cada vez que se destruye la fortaleza, pero cada vez que esto se logra, se agregan más y más barcos centinela a cada nivel sucesivo.

game.name: Rip-Off (1982)
game.desc: Beware of scavenging pirates trying to steal your precious fuel cells! The more pirates you destroy, the faster their successors become. Guard your tanks carefully... you are always outnumbered!

game.name: Rockaroids Remix: Third Rock (1996)
game.desc:
Este es un clon de asteroides, donde el jugador controla una nave que debe destruir los rockaroids disparándoles. Los grandes rockaroides se dividirán en dos medianos cuando se golpeen, que a su vez se dividirán en dos pequeños. La bonificación U. F. O.s también se puede destruir por grandes puntos, pero le disparan al jugador. Las naves adicionales se otorgan con cada 10,000 puntos y el hiperespacio se puede usar en una emergencia para enviar la nave del jugador a una ubicación aleatoria en la pantalla, pero podrían explotar al volver a entrar.
Ser destruido al volver a entrar, ser golpeado por un rockaroid o U. F. O. fuego destruirá la nave del jugador y el juego terminará cuando no queden más naves.

game.name: Cosmic Chasm (1982)
game.desc: Can you save the galaxy by blowing up the alien-inhabited planet ... and get off the planet before you explode too? You must burrow deep inside, finding your way through the underground maze while battling the Planet Protectors. If you can get to the center, plant your one bomb and try to find your way out. It's only a matter of seconds before the planet goes BOOM!

game.path: ./Patriots III - BALListics Busters by John Dondzila (2002).zip
game.name: Patriots III: Ballistics Busters (2002)
game.desc: Patriots III Ballistics Busters es una versión completamente reescrita del juego original con tres cañones y munición ilimitada. En esta versión, los cañones del jugador requerirán tiempo para recargarse, pero nunca se quedarán sin misiles como en las versiones anteriores. Además, esta versión también tiene una opción para controlar los sitios del jugador o la retícula a través de controles analógicos, en lugar de solo con controles digitales. Estos controles se parecen más a los controles utilizados en la versión arcade que eran los de una bola de seguimiento.
game.image: ./media/screenshot/Patriots III - BALListics Busters by John Dondzila (2002).png

game.name: Vaboom!/Vectrace (2000) (Ronen Habot)
game.desc: También conocido como Ronen's Game Cart, Vaboom! / Vectrace es un poco inusual de homebrew, ya que contiene uno de los pocos juegos de carreras para Vectrex (Vectrace). ¡Y también puede parecer inusual para otro Kaboom! clon para el sistema también (Vaboom !, como el primer clon, Spike's Water Balloons, del cartucho All Good Things, fue lanzado cuatro años antes). Podría decirse que esta extraña combinación de juegos no relacionados hace que este cartucho aún se destaque.

game.name: Spin Ball (1983)
game.desc: Get ready for even more excitement and split-second action than traditional arcade pinball. SpinBall's special features like a ball splitter, drop targets and ball savers will give you the ultimate pinball challenge. It even TILTS! SpinBall's action moves fast and furious. You'll need your sharpest reflexes to keep the ball in play and rack up bonus points.

game.name: Scramble Wars (1982)
game.desc: Watch out for that next mountain! Maneuver your ship over a rough terrain in an effort to destroy the enemy base. Careful piloting alone won't get you to your destination... You must brave rockets, UFOs, flamoids and some very tight tunnels. Few people have ever seen the enemy base, let alone destroy it. Will you be one of the select few?

game.name: Solar Quest (1982)
game.desc: How many types of alien vessels will you be able to destroy? Seven different types are after you. You must first destroy them and then attempt to rescue the survivors before that float into the sun. Don't get your ship too close to the sun... its high temperatures can destroy you.

game.name: Space Wars (1982)
game.desc: Who says there are no rules in intergalactic warfare. Pick your own - bounce, expanded universe, black hole - as you embark on a deadly dogfight.

game.name: Spike (1983)
game.desc: The dastardly villain, Spud, has kidnapped our heroine, the lovely and oh so innocent, Molly, and taken her far away to his secret hideout. "Eek! Help, Spike!" Spike, our courageous hero and Molly's true love, races to her rescue. He'll be relying on your skills and split-second timing to help him in his quest to save poor Molly. Maneuver Spike through treacherous obstacles and avoid the dangerous creatures along the way to Spud's hideout. If you're successful, Spike can rescue Molly and the two will live happily ever after - that is until Spud strikes again. "Oh. No!"

game.name: Spike Goes Skiing (1998) (PD)
game.desc:
In case you never played 'Horace goes Skiing' on the Spectrum (the inspiration for this title), here's the basic idea of the game.
Each level alternates between a Frogger section and a skiing section. In the Frogger part you have to cross the road to get to the ski shop, get your skis then cross back over the road to get to the ski slope. The game isn't going to follow the original exactly but hopefully it'll be just as much fun.

game.name: Spike Hoppin' (1998)
game.desc:
Spike Hoppin 'es un clon del juego Q * Bert, donde el jugador debe saltar sobre todas las áreas de una estructura para hacerlas del mismo color y avanzar al siguiente nivel. (Sin embargo, dado que el Vectrex no está en color, en este caso, el jugador debe hacer que todas las áreas [que están representadas por triángulos] en un campo de juego sean más brillantes u oscuras, dependiendo de los requisitos del nivel actual).
Varios enemigos con diversos gestos intentarán la caída de Spike, aunque algunos elementos pueden ayudar a Spike también durante un juego.
Bonus: Vectrepede es un juego de bonificación oculto que es un clon simplificado de Centipede.

game.name: Spike's Water Balloons (Analog) (2001) (PD)
game.desc: Aiuta l'eroe, Spike, a conquistare l'amore di Molly vincendo una partita bagnata e selvaggia di cattura di palloncini d'acqua.

game.name: Star Castle (1983)
game.desc: You and other experienced intergalactic voyagers have heard about and shared the legend of Star Castle - a mysterious fortress in a far away galaxy filled with incredible riches and surrounded by revolving walls of shimmering solid gold. Yet no one, until now, has ever actually seen the Castle - or lived to tell about it! As you approach, you are overwhelmed with the beauty of the Castle but you suddenly realize that the golden walls hide a deadly arsenal. To survive you must destroy the walls and the powerful Energy Cannon they shield. Perhaps you will be the first to survive the Star Castle's arsenal and prove the legend true. Perhaps not!

game.name: Star Fire Spirits (1999)
game.desc: Este es un clon del juego de vectores Atari Star Wars, que se compone de tres olas. El jugador comienza con seis unidades de escudo, que caerán cada vez que una nave espacial o cualquier otro obstáculo choque con el jugador o el jugador sea golpeado por el fuego enemigo; Si el jugador es golpeado cuando no le quedan más escudos, el juego terminará.

game.name: Star Hawk (1982)
game.desc: Fasten your seatbelt... you're the pilot defending the sovereignty of your planet. Don't blink - you might miss one of the alien vessels.

game.name: Star Wars Clone (1999)
game.desc: Lo scopo di questo gioco - un semplice gioco in stile "sparatutto" per uno o due giocatori - è viaggiare nello spazio e distruggere le navi Klingon e Romulane.

game.name: Star Ship (1982)
game.desc: Welcome, Captain Kirk, to your command on the Starship Enterprise. Your mission is to seek out and destroy the enemy Klingon Mothership. Travel through nine sectors of space, each more difficult, or take a shortcut through the Black Hole. Be careful ... the Klingons and Romulans are hiding in space, waiting to destroy you at every turn!

game.name: Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1982)
game.desc: Welcome, Captain Kirk, to your command on the Starship Enterprise. Your mission is to seek out and destroy the enemy Klingon Mothership. Travel through nine sectors of space, each more difficult, or take a shortcut through the Black Hole. Be careful ... the Klingons and Romulans are hiding in space, waiting to destroy you at every turn!

game.name: Tour De France (1983) (Prototype)
game.desc: A one player racing game published and developed by GCE in 1983.

game.name: V-Frogger (1998) (PD)
game.desc:
El juego arcade Frogger involucró a jugadores que guiaban a sus ranas a través de una concurrida calle de varios carriles, luego maniobraron a través de un área de agua en la segunda área del juego, saltando sobre troncos y las espaldas de tortugas y cocodrilos para alcanzar y llenar los cinco bahías de inicio de rana en la parte superior de la pantalla. Varios obstáculos y enemigos matarían a las ranas de los jugadores al contacto, así como si se les acabara el tiempo antes de llegar a una bahía de ranas, golpear una pared superior, ahogarse en el agua o pasar demasiado a la izquierda o la derecha bordes de la pantalla.
V-Frogger es un clon del arcade original con algunos cambios gráficos y mejoras.

game.name: Vecmania Part 1 (1999) (PD)
game.desc: Vecmania tiene la mayor cantidad de juegos para una compilación casera para Vectrex, con siete juegos completos (uno oculto) y dos demos sin terminar, que son clones de los juegos arcade de Tempest, Star Wars, Missile Command, Space Invaders, Eliminator, Breakout , Discos de Tron, Asteroides y Fénix.

game.name: Vecmania Part 2 (1999) (PD)
game.desc: Vecmania tiene la mayor cantidad de juegos para una compilación casera para Vectrex, con siete juegos completos (uno oculto) y dos demos sin terminar, que son clones de los juegos arcade de Tempest, Star Wars, Missile Command, Space Invaders, Eliminator, Breakout , Discos de Tron, Asteroides y Fénix.

game.name: Vectopia (2001) (PD)
game.desc:
A diferencia de la anterior Vecmania, que comprendía siete juegos completos y dos demos, la mayoría de Vectopia está compuesta por demos sin terminar y solo tres juegos completos.
Para recorrer los juegos, una vez que aparece la pantalla del menú después del encendido, el jugador debe presionar el botón uno en el controlador Vectrex, luego, para jugar un juego, debe presionar el botón cuatro

game.name: Vector Vaders (1999)
game.desc:
March 8, 1996 marked a day of the rebirth of Vectrex games, as programmer John Dondzila unveiled Vector Vaders, which was not only the very first homebrew game for the machine, but it also started the plethora of new games for the Vectrex as well.
Aside from having vector graphics and running a bit slow (although the game does speed up as more and more invaders are shot), this is a pretty standard Space Invaders-type game for the most part.

game.name: Vectrace (2000) (Ronen Habot)
game.desc: Conosciuto anche come Ronen's Game Cart, Vaboom! / Vectrace è un po 'un'insolita voce homebrew, poiché contiene uno dei pochissimi giochi di corse per il Vectrex (Vectrace). E potrebbe anche sembrare un po 'insolito per un altro Kaboom! clone da creare anche per il sistema (Vaboom !, poiché il primo clone, Spike's Water Balloons, dalla cartuccia All Good Things, è stato rilasciato quattro anni prima). Probabilmente, questo strano abbinamento di giochi fa risaltare ancora un po' questa cartuccia.

game.name: Vectrex Pong (1998) (PD)
game.desc: Vectrex Pong is an astonishingly simple pong clone. It doesn't feature a two player mode, it's just a one player game in which your opponent is a wall. No matter how good I get, I'll never be as good as the wall. It's relentless. Anyway, this game seems more like a simple test concept that Chris Salamon trotted out before unleashing his vastly superior Frogger clone.

game.name: Vectrexians (1999) (PD)
game.desc: Battlestations!! 20 hostile convoys are heading towards your home world! Fight bravely and focused against these attacking alien foes... Do you have what it takes to become the supreme Vectrexian?

game.name: Vix (2000) (PD)
game.desc: If you haven't figured it out, this is Taito's cult hit Qix. In Vix you have to defend the Internet by blocking off the Vix virus but beware of the sparks. Vix is still an awesome and relaxing that will make you think.

game.name: Verzerk (2002)
game.desc: Verzerk is a hack of Berzerk, adding speech this time around, with a robotic voice welcoming the player during the attract mode, then states "this is Verzerk". The phrases from the original arcade version of "shoot him", "chicken, fight like a robot", "got you humanoid", etc. are included in this release. The game plays identically to Berzerk though, aside from that and only being for one player.

game.name: Vexperience - B.e.t.h. And Vecsports Boxing By Manu (2000)
game.desc: Demo of Battle Earth Terror Hazard and VecSports Boxing, which published as a package called Vexperience.

game.path: ./We Wish You a Merry Christmas by J. Woolsey (1985) (PD).zip
game.name: ZZZ(notgame):We Wish You A Merry Christmas By J. Woolsey (1985) (PD)
Web Warp (1983)
game.desc: Enter a galaxy of the future filled with adventure and danger - a galaxy unlike any you have imagined before. You become the Hawk King - a creature capable of incredible speed and power - as you attempt to capture the amazing creatures that inhabit the speeding Web of Fantasy. All 20 creatures are protected by guardians and the dreaded Cosmic Dragon and each will become progressively more difficult to capture. No one has ever captured the elusive twentieth creature. Will you?

game.name: Wormhole (2001) (PD)
game.desc: Este es un clon del juego arcade Gyruss, donde el jugador controla una nave que puede girar alrededor de la pantalla en círculo y disparar a las naves que emergen rápidamente del área central de la pantalla. Después de que se despeja el primer nivel, comenzarán a disparar contra la nave del jugador, y también hay dos naves que aparecen más adelante en el juego que crean un campo de fuerza entre ellas (que disparar una o ambas naves deshabilitará el campo), junto con Un asteroide indestructible que emerge del agujero de gusano.

game.name: 3D Crazy Coaster (1983)
game.desc: Climb aboard the Crazy Coaster and get ready for a roller coaster ride more dangerous and exciting than any you've experienced before! The magic of Vectrex 3-D makes your ride so real... you'll feel yourself leaning with the G-force! You control the movements of the passenger in the lead car as he plummets down the spectacularly steep hills and careens around the gravity-defying curves of the Crazy Coaster. Will you be able to keep his arms raised throughout the ride without sending him flying off into space?!
